dataset.title: Rubisco limited photosynthesis rates of Red mangrove leaves at Key Largo, Watson River Chickee, Taylor Slough, and Little Rabbit Key, South Florida (FCE) from July 2001 to August 2001

abstract.para: Determine the Rubisco limited carboxylation rates of red mangrove ( species Rhizophora mangle) leaves. This information will be used to model carbon sequestration by Red mangroves.

intellectualRights.para: These data are classified as 'Type II' whereby original FCE LTER experimental data collected by individual FCE researchers to be released to restricted audiences according to terms specified by the owners of the data. Type II data are considered to be exceptional and should be rare in occurrence. The justification for exceptions must be well documented and approved by the lead PI and Site Data Manager. Some examples of Type II data restrictions may include: locations of rare or endangered species, data that are covered under prior licensing or copyright (e.g., SPOT satellite data), or covered by the Human Subjects Act, Student Dissertation data and those data related to the FCE LTER Program but not funded by the National Science Foundation (NSF) under LTER grant #DEB-9910514. Researchers that make use of Type II Data may be subject to additional restrictions to protect any applicable commercial or confidentiality interests. All publications based on this dataset must cite the data Contributor, the Florida Coastal Everglades Long-Term Ecological Research (LTER) Program and that this material is based upon work supported by the National Science Foundation through the Florida Coastal Everglades Long-Term Ecological Research program under Cooperative Agreements #DEB-1237517, #DBI-0620409, and #DEB-9910514. Additionally, two copies of the manuscript must be submitted to the Florida Coastal Everglades LTER Program Office, LTER Program Manager, Florida International University, Southeast Environmental Research Center, OE 148, University Park, Miami, Florida 33199. For a complete description of the FCE LTER Data Access Policy and Data User Agreement, please go to FCE Data Management Policy at http://fcelter.fiu.edu/data/DataMgmt.pdf and LTER Network Data Access Policy at http://fcelter.fiu.edu/data/core/data_user_agreement/distribution_policy.html.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Data were collected in the Key Largo Ranger Station, Watson River Chickee and Taylor Slough research Sites, South Florida
Florida Coastal Everglades LTER Study Area: South Florida, Everglades National Park, and Florida Bay

description.para: This is a short-term primary production dataset. This dataset replaces all previous versions of ST_PP_Barr_004. The FCE program is discontinuing its practice of versioning data as of March 2013.

changeHistory.changeScope: Added new Data download URL and new FCE III Project information
changeHistory.oldValue: Added new Data download URL where user not required to register with the LNO DAS.

description.para: The flux of carbon dioxide and water vapor was monitored from a number of leaves. Fluxes were only measured once a steady state value was reached. This typically took about 30 seconds to 60 seconds to occur. Light level was held at 1000 micromol m-2 s-1, leaf temperature at 30 C and reference cell CO2 mixing ratio (in parts per million) was sequentially decreased as follows - 380, 330, 280, 230, 180, 130, 80, 30.

methodStep.instrumentation: LiCor 6400 Gas Exchange system equipped with a red/blue light source in the sensor head.

description.para: The Study Extent of this dataset includes the Key Largo Ranger Station, Watson River Chickee and Taylor Slough research Sites, South Florida

samplingDescription.para: Gas samples were taken from 6 sq. cm sections on individual leaves. These leaves were always sampled from the surface to about 2.5 m height and leaves were selected that received direct sunlight. Measure transpiration rates and photosynthesis rates of individual Red mangrove leaves under varying sample cell carbon dioxide concentrations. Vmax, the Rubisco limited carboxylation rate, is determined from this procedure.

description.para: Dataset is inspected by PI for QA/QC; standard validation checks for negative numbers, graphs to detect potential outliers .

project.title: Florida Coastal Everglades LTER: Coastal Oligotrophic Ecosystems Research-the Coastal Everglades

abstract.para: We are investigating how variability in regional climate, freshwater inputs, disturbance, and perturbations affect the coastal Everglades ecosystem. Our long term research program focuses on testing the following central idea and hypotheses: Regional processes mediated by water flow control population and ecosystem level dynamics at any location within the coastal Everglades landscape. This phenomenon is best exemplified in the dynamics of an estuarine oligohaline zone where fresh water draining phosphorus-limited Everglades marshes mixes with water from the more nitrogen-limited coastal ocean. Hypothesis 1: In nutrient-poor coastal systems, long-term changes in the quantity or quality of organic matter inputs will exert strong and direct controls on estuarine productivity, because inorganic nutrients are at such low levels. Hypothesis 2: Interannual and long-term changes in freshwater flow controls the magnitude of nutrients and organic matter inputs to the estuarine zone, while ecological processes in the freshwater marsh and coastal ocean control the quality and characteristics of those inputs. Hypothesis 3: Long-term changes in freshwater flow (primarily manifest through management and Everglades restoration) will interact with long-term changes in the climatic and disturbance (sea level rise, hurricanes, fires) regimes to modify ecological pattern and process across coastal landscapes.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: The FCE LTER Project Study area is located in South Florida, mostly in Everglades National Park. There are a total of 21 sampling sites located in two major regions: 1) Shark River Slough and 2) Taylor Slough/Panhandle.

dataTable.entityDescription: Rubisco limited photosynthesis rates of Red mangrove leaves at Key Largo, Watson River Chickee, Taylor Slough, and Little Rabbit Key, South Florida (FCE)

attribute.attributeDefinition: Photosynthetically Active Radiation Measured by Quantum Sensor

datasetSubmissionNotes.notes: Using the LiCor 6400 gas exchange system is not entirely straightforward. Please contact me (Jordan Barr) if you have questions regarding the data collection.
